alert.note: Alert for Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 7:11PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northeast Washington, including the following county, Stevens. Also including the Ford Corkscrew burn scar. * WHEN...Until 900 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flooding of the Ford Corkscrew burns scar is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Radar has indicated this storm to produce a half an inch to an inch or rainfall. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. This includes the Ford Corkscrew burn scar. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ford. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
